org.hak5.ducky

Class State

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.hak5.ducky.State

  • public class State
extends java.lang.Object
    State machine that acts as the DuckyScript interpreter. Parses input file and acts on each keyword according to a set of commands. Each command then operates somehow on the state. Implemented as a singleton object since the interpreter can only have one state. Therefore, the new operator will throw an exception. The newInstance method should be used instead.
    Author:
    Jason Appelbaum, Kevin Polulak

      • setDelayOverride

        public void setDelayOverride(boolean value)
        Toggles whether or not to override the delay value.
        Parameters:
        value - boolean true overrides the delay, false restores it

      • getDelayOverride

        public boolean getDelayOverride()
        Returns the current state of the delay override.

        public boolean isFunctionKey(java.lang.String possibleFKey)
        Tests if the given string is a function key (for example, F1, F2, F3).
        Parameters:
        possibleFKey - string to test
        Returns:
        boolean true indicates string is a function key, otherwise false

      • begin

        public void begin()
        Starts state machine that parses input DuckyScript file. Reads file line by line and checks the valid command list for a match. If found, it calls the appropriate action method that executes the command.
